intro: Cynoglossum marifolium, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Cynoglossum marifolium is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed or open areas.
